info.title: BankID RA Service Provider Interface (SPI) for activation of BankID App
info.description:
Defines the interface to be provided by a Registration Authority service to support activation of BankID App as a HA2 element for an end user's Netcentric BankID.

An RA implementing the OTP administration group of operations may offer BankID App to all it's end users having a functioning Netcentric BankID with a code device.

If in addition, the RA implements the Activation without Code Device groups of operations then end users may activate the Bankid App without having another Code Device at all !

This SPI version corresponds to the document 'Specification of Solutions for Activation of BankID App as HA2-elements' version v.62

tags.name: Service availability
tags.description: Checks that the service is available

tags.name: OTP administration
tags.description: Adds or deletes BankID App from an end user's BankID

tags.name: Activation without Code Device - Self Service

post.summary: Tell end user that BankID App is activated
post.description: Request notification of the end user that his BankID App instance is activated

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: The Signature element, as described in Internet-Draft - Signing HTTP Messages.

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description:
The date element, required format is the format named 'preferred' specified in RFC 7231 - Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content.

Implementation tips: Format in Java is 'EEE, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss zzz', locale english.

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description:
SHA-256 hash of body

Implementation tips:MessageDigest.getIinstance("SHA-256") in Java returns an object which is not thread safe

200.description: If all ok, no data is returned

tags: Activation without Code Device - Self Service
post.summary: Request distribution of a verification code to be sent to an end user.
post.description:
Endpoint to request distribution of an a verification code to be sent to an end user. Upon receiving a request on this end-point, the RA should distribute the provided code over sms or return an error-code.

The RA should reject requests if they do not recognize the combination of nnin + msisdn

post.summary: Prohibit change of end user password
post.description: signal to the RA that self-service activation has reached the point where password change (automated or manual) MUST be prohibited until the provided timestamp, effective immediately.

parameters.description: The Signature element, as described in Internet-Draft - Signing HTTP Messages.

parameters.name: Date

The date element, required format is the format named 'preferred' specified in RFC 7231 - Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content.

Implementation tips: Format in Java is 'EEE, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss zzz', locale english.

SHA-256 hash of body

Implementation tips:MessageDigest.getIinstance("SHA-256") in Java returns an object which is not thread safe

requestBody.description: How long to quarantine the password

200.description: Time when password was last reset

tags: Activation without Code Device - Self Service
post.summary: Check two-channel options for end user
post.description:
Endpoint to check if a specific user is eligible from single originator for self-service activation.

The RA should check if the provided phone number is registered for the user, but return the other information regardless.

parameters.description: The Signature element, as described in Internet-Draft - Signing HTTP Messages.

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description:
The date element, required format is the format named 'preferred' specified in RFC 7231 - Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content.

Implementation tips: Format in Java is 'EEE, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss zzz', locale english.

SHA-256 hash of body

Implementation tips:MessageDigest.getIinstance("SHA-256") in Java returns an object which is not thread safe

requestBody.description: Activation code and how to distribute

NotifyUserOfActivationErrorResponseDTO.description: The result of asking an ra to notify a user of activation, used in case of some error

flow.description:
The flow used for activation, meanings:
  • - activation_code: A single activation code provided over a secure channel.
  • - selfservice: Activation codes provided over two insecure channels.
  • - bankid_auth: Activation through a BankID authentication.

via_distribution_methods.description: The distribution methods (if any) used during activation.

locale.description:
Locale of initiating app, either "no" for Norwegian and Norwegian dialects, otherwise "en"
(the 'no' value is shown as 'false', openapi nuisance)

additionalProperties.description: Map of localized strings explaining how the device was activated
additionalProperties.example: {"no":"med aktiveringskoder gitt på email til que***@xyz.no og på sms til XXX XX X42","en":"using activation codes by email to que***@xyz.no and sms to XXX XX X42"}

human_readable.description: Map of localized strings explaining how the device was activated

example.no: med aktiveringskoder gitt på email til que***@xyz.no og på sms til XXX XX X42
example.en: using activation codes by email to que***@xyz.no and sms to XXX XX X42

client_name.description: Name of client sending the request

request_id.description: A unique identifier pr. request, used for log correlation

originator_id.description: Originator/bank-number for end user's bankID, valid BankID ODS number

nnin.description: End user's Norwegian national identification number, string of 11 digits

activation_id.description: The id of this activation attempt, used for for logging

NotifyUserOfActivationRequestBodyDTO.description: Request body content for asking an RA to send a notification to an end user

hint.description:
A censored representation of the user's contact information.
  • - type sms: 6 X's followed by two unmasked digits XXX XX X42
  • - type email: 1-3 unmasked characters + "(...)" @ domain.topdomain, eg. dei(...)@gmail.com
  • - type official_address: No hint, details on the address must not be exposed.

originator_ref.description: An RA-specific ID which can be used to track the specific distribution method all the way back to the issuing RA.

ViaDistributionMethodDTO.description: Details of one distribution method used during activation.

SimpleErrorResponseDTO.description: Result when there is only an error code in return

request_id.description: A unique identifier pr. request, used for log correlation

originator_id.description: Originator/bank-number for end user's bankID, valid BankID ODS number

nnin.description: End user's Norwegian national identification number, string of 11 digits

activation_id.description: The id of this activation attempt, used for for logging, will be the same for both codes

msisdn_reference_id.description: The alias for the msisdn previously provided in a response from check-user

locale.description:
Locale of initiating app, either "no" for Norwegian and Norwegian dialects, otherwise "en"
(the 'no' value is shown as 'false', openapi nuisance)

exp.description: Time when code expire, ms since epoch, UTC

SendVerificationCodeRequestBodyDTO.description: Request body content for asking an RA to send verification code to end user

pw_reset_timestamp.description: Time when user's password was last reset, ms since epoch, UTC

PasswordQuarantineResponseDTO.description: Response when quarantining an end user password

request_id.description: A unique identifier pr. request, used for log correlation

originator_id.description: Originator/bank-number for end user's bankID, valid BankID ODS number

nnin.description: End user's Norwegian national identification number, string of 11 digits

activation_id.description: The id of this activation attempt, used for for logging

quarantine_until.description: Time when quarantine expire, ms since epoch, UTC

PasswordQuarantineRequestBodyDTO.description: Request body content for quarantining the user password

type.description:
Type of distribution
  • - email: 1-3 unmasked characters + "(...)" @ domain.topdomain, eg. dei(...)@gmail.com
  • - postal: No hint, details on the address must not be exposed.

id.description: An id for this distribution method, must be unique within this response

hint.description: Hint to user, ex. "que****@hotmail.com" or empty string on official_address

last_confirmed_by_user.description: When was this contact information last confirmed to be correct by the user, ms since epoch, UTC

last_modified.description: When was this contact information last modified, ms since epoch, UTC

DistributionMethodDTO.description: Declaration for Methods for distribution and

id.description: An opaque reference which will be used as an alias for the msisdn.

last_confirmed_by_user.description: When was msisdn last confirmed to be correct by the user, ms since epoch, UTC

last_modified.description: When was msisdn last modified, ms since epoch, UTC

MsisdnReferenceDTO.description: If the msisdn given in the request is correct, return a MsisdnReference object otherwise msisdn_reference=null.

pw_reset_timestamp.description: Time when the user's password was last reset, ms since epoch, UTC

SelfServiceCheckUserResponseDTO.description: The result of querying RA about end user distribution methods

cc_count.description: Country code length, this is provided purely for convenience.

e164_number.description: Phone number, always provided with country code and without leading zeroes or +.

activation_id.description: The id of this activation attempt, used for for logging

nnin.description: End user's Norwegian national identification number, string of 11 digits

activation_id.description: The id of this activation attempt, used for for logging, will be the same for both codes

Locale of initiating app, either "no" for Norwegian and Norwegian dialects, otherwise "en"
(the 'no' value is shown as 'false', openapi nuisance)

code_words.description: The two code words to distribute

exp.description: Time when code expire, ms since epoch, UTC

SendCodeWordsRequestBodyDTO.description: Request body content for asking an RA to send code words to an end user

status.description:
Status value for end user's BAPP
  • NOT_ENABLED - BAPP is not enabled, but could be
  • ENABLED - BAPP is enabled for the end user
  • NOT_AVAILABLE - BAPP is not available for the bank
  • BANK_ID_NOT_AVAILABLE - end user doesn't have active BankID
  • BLOCKED_BY_BANK - end user is not allowed to use BAPP
  • BLOCKED_IN_ODS - BAPP is connected to the BankID, but was blocked by ODS because of wrong attempts

StatusBappResponseDTO.description: The result of asking if BankID app is enabled for an end user's BankID

client_name.description: Name of client sending the request

request_id.description: A unique identifier pr. request, used for log correlation

originator_id.description: Originator/bank-number for end user's bankID, valid BankID ODS number

nnin.description: End user's Norwegian national identification number, string of 11 digits

AuthenticationBodyDTO.description: Minimal body for authenticating and authorizing a request

status.description:
Status value for add operation
  • ENABLED - BAPP is enabled for the end user
  • NOT_ENABLED - Failed to enable BAPP for the customer
  • ALREADY_ENABLED - BAPP was already enabled
  • NOT_AVAILABLE - BAPP is not available for the bank
  • BANK_ID_NOT_AVAILABLE - end user doesn't have active BankID
  • BLOCKED_BY_BANK - end user is not allowed to use BAPP
  • BLOCKED_IN_ODS - BAPP is connected to the BankID, but was blocked by ODS because of wrong attempts

AddBappResponseDTO.description: The result of trying to enable BankID app for an end user's BankID

status.description:
Status value for the delete operation
  • DELETED - BAPP was successfully deleted
  • NOT_ENABLED - BAPP hasn't been enabled for the end user, nothing to delete.
  • BLOCKED_IN_ODS - BAPP wasn't deleted, since it is present and blocked by ODS because of wrong attempts

DeleteBappResponseDTO.description: The result of trying to remove BankID app from an end user's BankID
